::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module2_mcq_q34')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">
Suppose a stock generates quarterly realized returns of RQ1 = 5%, RQ2 = 2%, RQ3 = −3%, and RQ4 = 4%.  
What is the realized annual return for the year, considering compounding?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q34" value="A"> A. 7.8%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q34" value="B"> B. 8.2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q34" value="C"> C. 8.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q34" value="D"> D. 8.9%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q34" value="E"> E. 9.2%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q34" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: D. The realized annual return is computed as:  
\((1+R_{annual}) = (1+0.05)(1+0.02)(1−0.03)(1+0.04) = 1.0889\).  
Thus, \(R_{annual} ≈ 8.9\%\).  
This illustrates how realized returns must account for compounding across subperiods.
</div>
:::
